titles.title: A joint resolution to void certain agreements relating to the site of the Soviet Union's embassy in the District of Columbia.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

bill.summary: 4/30/1987--Introduced. Makes congressional findings concerning Soviet espionage activities at the new American Embassy in Moscow and the location of the new Soviet Embassy in Washington, D.C. Directs the President to: (1) void the current Embassy agreements with the Soviet Union; and (2) enter into negotiations for a new agreement under which the Soviet Union will move its new Embassy to a site in Washington, D.C., which is not more than 90 feet above mean sea level.
